publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in ŠorčuqStadthöhleduring T III Š 80.03

sourceDesc.p: Transcription and references have been transferred from the "Text and Reference Database of the Tocharian A Language" (Gerd Carling Lund University) (funded by the Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation and SCAS).
Transcription and translation are based on .

seg.seg: « ... (blameless) you are. For this reason precisely annoyance has come to me here. See, [my] daughter! » In [the tune] śāntawantāk: « The excellence of [your] beauty

... (makellos) bist du. [Aber] aus diesem Grunde eben [ist] mir hier Besorgnis gekommen. Sieh, [meine] Tochter: || Im Metrum Śāntavantaka(?) || Der Vorzug [deiner] Schönheit ... deine Lieblichkeit [ist] in allen Gegenden Verbreitet. Aus den großen benachbarten Ländern [sind] die Weiber der Könige gekommen. Das eigene Leben ... um die (Gatten)perle bitten sie. Wenn ich dich einem König gebe, werden die anderen meine Feinde werden. Sie werden mit ihrem vierfachen Heere kommen ...

... you are (without blemish). [But] for this very reason apprehension has come [over] me. See, [my] daughter: In the Śāntavantaka(?) metre || The excellence of [your] beauty ... your grace [has] spread into all lands. From the great neighbouring countries the wives of the kings [have] come. The own life ... for the pearl of spouses they ask. If I give you to one king, the others will become my enemies. They will come with their fourfold army ...
... your pleasantness has spread into all directions; envoys of the kings have come from all the great neighbouring countries. The own life
... for the jewel (of a spouse) they ask. 1. If I give you to one king, the others will become my enemies. They will come with [their] fourfold army
If I give you to one king, the others will be enemies to me, they will come with [their] fourfold army.
Sie werden mit [ihrem] vierfachen Heere kommen.
They will come with [their] fourfold army.
... In order to think about my annoyance for your sake I was sitting in the palace above with [my] cheeks in the palm of [my] hand. Consider, [my] daughter, how (shall I) do? » (2.)
Bedenke, [meine] Tochter, wie (soll ich) [es] machen?
Consider, [my] daughter, how (shall I) do [it]?
(Thereupon Bhadrā speaks to herself:) « I have been born as a result of a wish: certainly king Brahmadatta shall be my husband. But [this is] not possible for me, (unless) by my own

(effort (?)) ... ». (Thereup)on she says to the king: « Oh lord, do not worry because of that, for the custom [is] this one in that case: As one loved by very many, a (king's daugther may choose herself) a king
O Herr, aus diesem Grunde sei du nicht bekümmert, denn Veranlassung hierzu [ist] überhaupt nicht.
Oh lord, for this reason do not be aggrieved, for there [is] no cause for it.
(as husband). (There)fore I, too, will choose a husband for myself, according to [my] own will after having been exposed to the Svayaṃvara. No peril will come to you. » Having (been) rejoiced ...
Therefore I too will choose a husband for myself in the svayaṃvara, free and according to my own will! (cf 9)
Dir soll nicht Not kommen.
Penury shall not come onto thee.
Darum werde auch ich in den Svayaṃvara eintreten und nach eigenem Ermessen mir den Gatten wählen [wtl. machen].
Therefore, I, too, will enter the Svayaṃvara and choose [lit. make] a husband for me after my own will.
... Thereupon king Mahendrasena having gathered all [his] ministers, commanded them [the following command] to be announced by envoys outside the country [lit. in countries that lie before]:
(in the tune N.N.): « In (all) regions, all [you people of other] countries, listen! The daughter of king Mahendrasena, the jewel of women named Bhadrā, (having) surpassed
(all other women) ... descends in the eastern part [lit. direction] of the city to the place of the Svayaṃvara. Whoever [of you] have power, zeal (?), strength [and] manly
(nature) ... having made (yourselves) ready, come on this day to this place! The wish made will be fulfilled for you. You will take delight in the jewel of women. »
Make [yourself, pl.] ready and come to the place that day, so that your [pl.] cherished wish will be fulfilled [and] you [pl.] will enjoy yourself with the pearl of women.
Rüstet euch [und] kommt an dem Tag zu dem Platz! Es wird euch in Erfüllung gehen der gehegte Wunsch. Ihr werdet euch an der Frauenperle erfreuen.
Equip yourselves and come to the place on this day! The wish you had will be fulfilled for you. You will take delight in the pearl of women.
(1.) ... (After having heard that, the envoys) went out from the city Videhaka [and] having come each to [their] countries, they announced that matter to the [respective] kings. Thereupon they

p.note: The translation is largely based on 8-9, and .
About 13 syllables are missing at the beginning of the line.
The gap at the beginning of this line must have contained the name of a tune with 4x25 syllables, rhythm 5/5/8/7.

muk is known otherwise as the translation of Skt. yuga- 'yoke', but this meaning does not fit this context because nati and tampe are abstract notions of positive qualities. 261 suggests that here it transposes Skt. yoga-, with the meaning “harnessed team, unit”; however, that is not a likely translation either. Possibly, muk here rather transposes Skt. yoga- in the abstract sense of 'dispostion, fitness, zeal'.

div.p: Edition38-39. Siegling's personal copy of p. 38 p. 39.

list.item: a1 /// (sne nā)käm naṣt tanäk ṣurmaṣ täṣ ñi_(TA)|ñi krāso_(TA)|krāso kakmu pälkār ckācar || śāntawantākaṃ || # arämpātṣi , kāswone|kāswo|(ne) a2 ; %7 #1a %4 , (ci)ñcrone ; puk kälymentwaṃ , sätko tñi : #1b śāwaṃ wārtskās , ypeyäntwäṣ ; kakmuṣṣ ārtañ , lāñcäśśi : #1c ṣñi śol a3 %5 ; (śna)ṣ(i) ñemi , pāṃsanträ : 1 #1d ṣomāp lānt_(TA)|lānt em , k_uprene cu ; ālyek yäsluṣ , tāke-ñi : #2a śmeñc śtwar wäknā , ratkaśśäl ; a4 /// %7 : #2b caṣ näṣ krāso_(TA)|krāso , cu ṣurmaṣ ; pältsäṅkātsi , tpär ṣtāṅkaṃ : #2c lymā āleyaṃ , śanweṃyo ; ppälskār ckācar , mänt yal|ya|(l) a5 ñi_(TA)|(ñi : 2) #2d (tmäṣ bhādrā ṣñi āñmaśśäl träṅkäṣ ā)kāl ritorā tatmus nasam ṣäkk atsek nāñi brahmadatte wäl pats mäskal mā_(TA)|mā nu ñkā yātal mäccākye a6 /// (tmä)ṣ lāntac träṅkäṣ nātäk taṃ ṣurmaṣ tu_(TA)|tu mar yutkatār k_uyalte tiri tṣaṃ tmäk māk mākiss ārtus lānt_(TA)|lānt – b1 /// (tä)my(o) ñuk p(e)nu svayamparaṃ tsälporäṣ ṣñi mänwā pats yāmmār mar tñi ñātse kumnäṣ || kātkmāṃ n(āṃtsu) b2 /// tmäṣ mahendrasene wäl āmāśās kākkropuräṣ cesmäk ārtaśśi anaprä ypeyaṃ tpässi wotäk || b3 /// (|| # puk kä)lymetwaṃ puk ; ypeyu päklyoṣäs ; lānt_(TA)|lānt mahendra,senes ckācar ; k_uleñci ñemi , bhādrā ñom : #1a yukos|yu|(kos) b4 %6 kārnaṣ ; koṃ-pärkāñcāṃ , kälyme riyis ; swayamparṣiṃ , lameyaṃ : #1b kene kusne naṣ ; nati muk tampe ; oñi-cmolṣi|oñi|(cmolṣi) b5 , %8 , (ṣñi āñcä)m : #1c ārwar yāmuräṣ ; cam koṃ tām tkanā ; pukmäs knatr-äm , rito ākāl ; plāntac k_uleñciṃ , ñemiyo b6 (1) #1d /// (täm kaklyuṣuräṣ ārtañ) v(i)dehak riyäṣ lcär cam wram ṣñi ṣñi ypeyac kälkoräṣ lāñcäśśi ākṣiññār tmäṣ cem

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3 If I give you to one king, the others will be enemies to me, they will come with [their] fourfold army. 638
b1 Therefore I too will choose a husband for myself in the svayaṃvara, free and according to my own will! (cf [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9) 220
b5 Make [yourself, pl.] ready and come to the place that day, so that your [pl.] cherished wish will be fulfilled [and] you [pl.] will enjoy yourself with the pearl of women. 266


Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1-3 ... (makellos) bist du. [Aber] aus diesem Grunde eben [ist] mir hier Besorgnis gekommen. Sieh, [meine] Tochter: || Im Metrum Śāntavantaka(?) || Der Vorzug [deiner] Schönheit ... deine Lieblichkeit [ist] in allen Gegenden Verbreitet. Aus den großen benachbarten Ländern [sind] die Weiber der Könige gekommen. Das eigene Leben ... um die (Gatten)perle bitten sie. Wenn ich dich einem König gebe, werden die anderen meine Feinde werden. Sie werden mit ihrem vierfachen Heere kommen ... 147, 157, 180, 192
a3 Sie werden mit [ihrem] vierfachen Heere kommen. 472, fn. 1
a4-5 Bedenke, [meine] Tochter, wie (soll ich) [es] machen? 180
a6 O Herr, aus diesem Grunde sei du nicht bekümmert, denn Veranlassung hierzu [ist] überhaupt nicht. 157
b1 Dir soll nicht Not kommen. 76
b1 Darum werde auch ich in den Svayaṃvara eintreten und nach eigenem Ermessen mir den Gatten wählen [wtl. machen]. 80, 429
b5 Rüstet euch [und] kommt an dem Tag zu dem Platz! Es wird euch in Erfüllung gehen der gehegte Wunsch. Ihr werdet euch an der Frauenperle erfreuen. 102

a1 « ... (blameless) you are. For this reason precisely annoyance has come to me here. See, [my] daughter! » In [the tune] śāntawantāk: « The excellence of [your] beauty a2 ... your pleasantness has spread into all directions; envoys of the kings have come from all the great neighbouring countries. The own life a3 ... for the jewel (of a spouse) they ask. 1. If I give you to one king, the others will become my enemies. They will come with [their] fourfold army a4 ... In order to think about my annoyance for your sake I was sitting in the palace above with [my] cheeks in the palm of [my] hand. Consider, [my] daughter, how (shall I) do? » (2.) a5 (Thereupon Bhadrā speaks to herself:) « I have been born as a result of a wish: certainly king Brahmadatta shall be my husband. But [this is] not possible for me, (unless) by my own a6 (effort (?)) ... ». (Thereup)on she says to the king: « Oh lord, do not worry because of that, for the custom [is] this one in that case: As one loved by very many, a (king's daugther may choose herself) a king b1 (as husband). (There)fore I, too, will choose a husband for myself, according to [my] own will after having been exposed to the Svayaṃvara. No peril will come to you. » Having (been) rejoiced ... b2 ... Thereupon king Mahendrasena having gathered all [his] ministers, commanded them [the following command] to be announced by envoys outside the country [lit. in countries that lie before]: b3 (in the tune N.N.): « In (all) regions, all [you people of other] countries, listen! The daughter of king Mahendrasena, the jewel of women named Bhadrā, (having) surpassed b4 (all other women) ... descends in the eastern part [lit. direction] of the city to the place of the Svayaṃvara. Whoever [of you] have power, zeal (?), strength [and] manly b5 (nature) ... having made (yourselves) ready, come on this day to this place! The wish made will be fulfilled for you. You will take delight in the jewel of women. » b6 (1.) ... (After having heard that, the envoys) went out from the city Videhaka [and] having come each to [their] countries, they announced that matter to the [respective] kings. Thereupon they
Gerd Carling, Georges-Jean Pinault, Melanie Malzahn

The translation is largely based on [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 8-9, and [[Carling, DThTA]].

a1. The tune has 4x14 syllables, rhythm 7/7.

a6. About 13 syllables are missing at the beginning of the line.

b3. The gap at the beginning of this line must have contained the name of a tune with 4x25 syllables, rhythm 5/5/8/7.

a1 /// _k_am na_ṣ_t\• ta_n_ak ṣurma_ṣ _t_aṣ ñi krāso kakmu _p_alkār ckāca_r\• || śāntawantākaṃ || a_r_ampātṣi kāswo a2 /// ñcrone pu_k _k_alymentwaṃ _s_atko tñi : śāwaṃ wārtskās ypeyäntwä_ṣ\• kakmuṣṣ ārtañ lāñcäśśi : ṣñi śo_l\• a3 /// ○ ṣ· ñemi pāṃsant_r_a : 1 ṣomāp lān_t\• e_m\• k_uprene cu ālyek yäsluṣ tāke-ñi : śmeñcä\ śtwar wäknā ratkaśśä_l\• a4 /// ○ : ca_ṣ _n_aṣ krāso cu ṣurma_ṣ _p_a_lt_s_aṅkātsi _t_p_ar ṣtāṅkaṃ : lymā āleyaṃ śanweṃyo _p_p_alskār ckācar _m_an_t\• ya a5 /// kāl ritorā tatmus nasa_m\• _ṣ_akk atsek nāñi brahmadatte wäl pat_s _m_aska_l\• mā nu ñkā yāta_l _m_accākye a6 /// ṣ lāntac t_r_aṅ_k_aṣ nā_t_a[k taṃ] ṣurmaṣ tu ma_r\• yutkatā_r\• k_uyalte tiri tṣaṃ _t_m_ak mā_k\• mākiss ārtus lān_t\• – b1 /// [m]y(·) [ñuk p](·)[n]u svayamparaṃ t_s_alpo_r_a_ṣ\• ṣñi _m_anwā [p]ats yāmmār mar tñi ñātse kumnä_ṣ\• || kātkmāṃ [n](· –) b2 /// _t_m_aṣ mahendrasene wä_l\• āmāśās kākkropu_r_aṣ ce_s_m_a_k\• ārtaśśi anap_r_a ypeyaṃ _t_p_assi wo_t_a_k\• || b3 /// ○ lymetwaṃ pu_k\• ypeyu _p_aklyo_ṣ_a_s\• lān_t\• mahendrasene_s\• ckāca_r\• k_uleñci ñemi bhādrā ño_m\• : yu b4 /// ○ kārna_ṣ\• koṃ-_p_arkāñcāṃ _k_alyme riyi_s\• swayamparṣiṃ lameyaṃ : kene kusne naṣ nati muk tampe oñi b5 /// – _m\• : ārwar yāmu_r_aṣ cam koṃ tā_m\• tkanā pu_k_m_a_s\• kna_t_r-_a_m\• rito ākā_l\• plāntacä\ k_uleñciṃ ñemiyo b6 /// [v](·)deha_k\• riyä_ṣ\• _lcä_r\• cam wra_m\• ṣñi ṣñi ypeyac _k_alko_r_a_ṣ\• lāñcäśśi ākṣiññā_r\• _t_m_aṣ ce_m\•

b4. muk is known otherwise as the translation of Skt. yuga- 'yoke', but this meaning does not fit this context because nati and tampe are abstract notions of positive qualities. [[Couvreur 1954b]]: 261 suggests that here it transposes Skt. yoga-, with the meaning “harnessed team, unit”; however, that is not a likely translation either. Possibly, muk here rather transposes Skt. yoga- in the abstract sense of 'dispostion, fitness, zeal'.
